data.name: Multiples of 3 or 5, but the inputs are big
data.description:
## Backstory

This problem is based on a former kata:

https://www.codewars.com/kata/514b92a657cdc65150000006

A friend of mine was complaining about this kata is being too easy, and should have a white rank instead of a yellow one. He was preparing for an interview, and felt like he need a more challenging task. Let's help him!

If you read the task of this kata, and think this is still too easy for you, here is a more challenging version of this kata:

https://www.codewars.com/kata/62e66bea9db63bab88f4098c

## The task

As mentioned in the original description:

"If we list all the natural numbers below 10 that are multiples of 3 or 5, we get 3, 5, 6 and 9. The sum of these multiples is 23.

Finish the solution so that it returns the sum of all the multiples of 3 or 5 below the number passed in."

Seems easy, right? What if I tell you that this time you're gonna get numbers up to 30 digits long? The task is still the same, but this time you cannot simply solve it with a for loop.

## Additional information

- Your input: a string containing a positive, whole number
- Your output: a string containing your solution
- You can expect your input to be a valid, containing only digits (0-9)
- The maximum input length is 30 digits, and there are 300+ test cases, so brute force solutions will not pass
